API Reference

Flask Application (src.app)

app.py - Flask web application for Grad Cafe data analysis.

This is the main web server that shows the analysis dashboard. Users can pull new data from Grad Cafe and refresh results.

Routes:

GET / - analysis dashboard POST /pull_data - kick off a background scrape + load POST /update_analysis - refresh results (no-op when busy) GET /status - JSON busy check for frontend polling

Author: Aaron Xu Course: JHU Modern Software Concepts Date: February 2026

src.app.create_app(config=None)[source]

Application factory — creates and configures the Flask app.

Pass a config dict to override DATABASE_URL, SCRAPER_FUNC, LOADER_FUNC, or TESTING (synchronous pull for test assertions).

src.app.get_database_url()[source]

Read DATABASE_URL from the environment, fall back to local default.

src.app.get_db_connection(database_url=None)[source]

Open a psycopg2 connection to the given (or default) database.

src.app.main()[source]

Start the dev server on port 5000.

src.app.run_analysis_queries(database_url=None)[source]

Run all nine required queries plus two custom ones.

Returns a dict whose keys line up with the Jinja template variables in index.html. If database_url is None we use the environment default.

Web Scraper (src.scrape)

scrape.py - Web scraper for thegradcafe.com.

Uses urllib (built-in) for HTTP requests and BeautifulSoup for HTML parsing. Rate-limits requests to be polite to the server.

Author: Aaron Xu Course: JHU Modern Software Concepts Date: February 2026

src.scrape.clean_text(text)[source]

Strip HTML tags and collapse whitespace. Returns None for empty.

src.scrape.extract_entries(html)[source]

Parse a Grad Cafe list page and pull out individual entries.

src.scrape.load_data(filename='applicant_data.json')[source]

Load data from a JSON file. Returns [] if the file is missing.

src.scrape.parse_additional_row(row, entry)[source]

Parse the extra rows that hold tags (GPA, season, GRE) and comments.

src.scrape.parse_main_row(row, tds)[source]

Pull university, program, degree, status, and link from the main row.

src.scrape.save_data(data, filename='applicant_data.json')[source]

Dump data to a JSON file (creates parent dirs if needed).

src.scrape.scrape_data(result_type='all', num_pages=500, start_page=1, delay=0.5)[source]

Scrape Grad Cafe list pages and return a list of entry dicts.

Each page has ~20 entries. We stop early if a page comes back empty or we hit too many consecutive errors.

Data Cleaner (src.clean)

clean.py - Data cleaning and standardization.

Takes raw scraped data and normalizes it: cleans GPA/GRE values, converts dates to ISO format, strips leftover HTML, and standardizes status labels (Accepted/Rejected/Waitlisted).

Author: Aaron Xu Course: JHU Modern Software Concepts Date: February 2026

src.clean.clean_data(raw_data, use_llm=False)[source]

Run all cleaning steps on a list of raw applicant dicts.

src.clean.clean_status(status)[source]

Map raw status text to Accepted / Rejected / Waitlisted.

src.clean.load_cleaned_data(filename='applicant_data_cleaned.json')[source]

Load cleaned data from JSON. Returns [] if missing.

src.clean.parse_date(date_str)[source]

Convert MM/DD/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD to ISO format. Returns None on failure.

src.clean.parse_program_university(text)[source]

Try to split ‘Program at University’ or ‘Program, University’.

src.clean.remove_html(text)[source]

Strip HTML tags and decode common entities.

src.clean.save_cleaned_data(data, filename='applicant_data_cleaned.json')[source]

Dump cleaned data to JSON.

src.clean.standardize_gpa(gpa)[source]

Parse a GPA string and format it to two decimals (0-4.0 range).

src.clean.standardize_gre(score)[source]

Extract digits from a GRE score string. Returns None if invalid.

Database Loader (src.load_data)

load_data.py - Load applicant data into PostgreSQL.

Creates the applicants table, converts JSON records into rows, and bulk-inserts them. The url column has a UNIQUE constraint so that re-pulling the same data won’t create duplicates.

Author: Aaron Xu Course: JHU Modern Software Concepts Date: February 2026

src.load_data.convert_international_status(value)[source]

Map True/False/’International’/’American’ to a consistent label.

src.load_data.create_table(database_url=None)[source]

Run CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS for the applicants table.

src.load_data.get_database_url()[source]

Read DATABASE_URL from the environment, fall back to local default.

src.load_data.insert_records(records, database_url=None)[source]

Bulk-insert records, skipping any whose url already exists.

src.load_data.load_json_data(filepath)[source]

Load JSON from filepath; returns [] if the file doesn’t exist.

src.load_data.main()[source]

CLI entry point — load the Module 2 JSON into Postgres.

src.load_data.prepare_row(entry)[source]

Convert one applicant dict into a tuple for the INSERT statement.

src.load_data.safe_float(value)[source]

Try to convert value to float; return None if it fails.

Query Functions (src.query_data)

query_data.py - SQL queries for the Grad Cafe analysis.

Each function runs one query and returns its result. They all accept an optional database_url so the test suite can point them at a separate test database.

Author: Aaron Xu Course: JHU Modern Software Concepts Date: February 2026

src.query_data.get_connection(database_url=None)[source]

Open a psycopg2 connection to the given (or default) database.

src.query_data.get_database_url()[source]

Read DATABASE_URL from the environment, fall back to local default.

src.query_data.main()[source]

Print all query results to the terminal.

src.query_data.query_acceptance_by_degree(database_url=None)[source]

Custom Q2: Acceptance rate by degree type.

src.query_data.query_american_fall_2026_gpa(database_url=None)[source]

Q4: Average GPA of American students in Fall 2026.

src.query_data.query_average_scores(database_url=None)[source]

Q3: Average GPA, GRE, GRE V, GRE AW for applicants who report them.

src.query_data.query_fall_2025_acceptance_rate(database_url=None)[source]

Q5: What percent of Fall 2025 entries are acceptances?

src.query_data.query_fall_2026_acceptance_gpa(database_url=None)[source]

Q6: Average GPA of accepted Fall 2026 applicants.

src.query_data.query_fall_2026_count(database_url=None)[source]

Q1: How many entries applied for Fall 2026?

src.query_data.query_international_percentage(database_url=None)[source]

Q2: What percentage of entries are international?

src.query_data.query_jhu_masters_cs(database_url=None)[source]

Q7: How many applicants to JHU Masters in Computer Science?

src.query_data.query_top_programs(database_url=None)[source]

Custom Q1: Top 10 most popular programs.

src.query_data.query_top_schools_phd_cs(database_url=None)[source]

Q8: 2026 PhD CS acceptances at Georgetown/MIT/Stanford/CMU.

src.query_data.query_top_schools_phd_cs_llm(database_url=None)[source]

Q9: Same as Q8 using LLM-generated fields.

src.query_data.run_all_queries(database_url=None)[source]

Convenience wrapper — runs all queries and returns a single dict.
